result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Adam J. Sutton

records.addlTxt:
Pre-trial conference on October 19, 2022 at 09:40 am.
Status conference on November 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.

[MK] cases #21CF437, #22CF229, #22CF277 called at 9:04am
Defendant Adam J. Sutton in court with Attorney Amber Rumpf.  ADA Jeffrey Shock in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

In Cases #22CF229 and #22CF277 Prelim-Waiver and Arraignment are held: 
--Mr. Sutton waives his right to Preliminary Hearings; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trials.
--service of Informations admitted, reading waived;  the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" are entered in both cases
--in response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate that they are not requesting speedy trials.
recess 9:10am

NEXT:   (1) Pretrial Conference on October 19th at 9:40am,   (2) Status Conference on November 7th at 10:00am
Preliminary hearing on September 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 5, 2022 at 11:00 am.

[MK] cases #21CF437, #22CF229, #22CF277 called at 11:46am
Defendant Adam J. Sutton in court with Attorney Amber Rumpf. ADA Theresa Beck appear for the State of Wisconsin.
M.Balda from WCS appears by telephone.
Attorney Rumpf provides information on Mr. Sutton's employment and financial situation regarding WCS payments. 
Arguments are given by counsel regarding the WCS non-payment and tamper-assertion issues.  
Mr. Balda confirms that WCS will continue Scram monitoring. 
The Court indicates that Scram monitoring is to continue.
After discussion with counsel ,the Court clarifies that the June 14th Bond Motion has been disposed of and that the Court is denying the forfeiture of bail [the $100 cash bond that was posted on 5/20/22].   
Attorney Rumpf verifies the Defense waiver of preliminary hearing time limits.
recess 12:01pm

NEXT:  Status Conference in #21CF437 and Preliminary Hearings in #22CF229 and #22CF277--all on August 5th at 11:00am
Status conference on July 22, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Status conference on July 14, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Conditions of this Bond include: 
--no possession or use of alcohol
--no operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license

[MK] case called at 1:21pm
Defendant Adam Sutton appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Cassi Nelson (the PD will appoint counsel).  Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Nelson agrees that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 

The Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
Preliminary Hearing time limit is waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $100 Cash Bond with conditions:
--no possession or use of alcohol
--no operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license
recess 1:27pm. 

NEXT: Status Conference on July 14th at 3:00pm--JA note in comments that the case is at prelim stage
